title: How to Find Out Which Planes Are Flying Overhead
steps: Launch Plane Finder.
View your location.
Zoom into your location.
View information of the plane(s) flying overhead.

title: How to Wish on a Star
steps: Look for a shooting star.
Close your eyes while wishing.
Don’t tell anyone your wish.
Look for a bright star if you can’t find a shooting star.
Believe in your wish.

title: How to Know Your Local Weather
steps: Find your weather channel by looking at your TV guide.
Tune into a local news channel.
Look for Weather scan if available in your TV guide.

title: How to Read Wind Barbs
steps: Find wind barbs for your area.
Overlay wind barbs onto a compass or another orientating guide.
Convert wind speed from knots.
Use wind barbs to evaluate wind safety.

title: How to See the Green Flash
steps: Understand the phenomenon of the green flash.
Choose your location.
Choose the right time.
Locate the place where the sun will set or rise.
Wait until the last part of the sun appears to be touching the horizon.
Watch for a flash, flicker, or brief glow of bright green light.
Relish it; it really is there only for the blink of an eye.
Keep looking until it becomes easier to find the green flash.

title: How to Track Your Sodium Intake
steps: Look at the nutrition label of a food product.
If you are eating out, ask the restaurant waiter how much sodium is in the dish you are ordering.
Look at the nutrition information in fast food before you order at a fast food restaurant.
Know how much salt is in your homemade dishes.
Use an app to track your sodium.

title: How to Find Net Carbs
steps: Try out an online carb counter.
Download an app to look up net carbs on the go.
Keep track of the net carbs in all the foods you regularly eat.

title: How to Identify the Stars
steps: Use a star chart to locate other stars and constellations.
Read star atlases to get more familiar with the night sky.
Download stargazing apps to get interactive views of your night sky.
Visit a star mapping website to plan your stargazing.

title: How to Use Orion to Find Other Constellations
steps: Know where Orion is.
Memorize the "corner" stars in Orion.
Time to start navigating!.
Continue following Saiph and Bellatrix and you will encounter Perseus, the hero from Greek mythology.
Follow Rigel and Betelgeuse, the two brightest stars in Orion, up to enter Gemini and view its two brightest stars, Castor and Pollux.
Tracing from Bellatrix to Betelgeuse leads to Canis Minor, shining with the bright stars Procyon and Gomeisa.
Draw an imaginary line from Rigel to Bellatrix and you will crash into Capella, the brightest star in the constellation Auriga.
After you have found these stars, use them to find more constellations.

title: How to Use a Color Filter for a Telescope
steps: Know about Moon Filters.
Learn about yellow filters.
Learn about orange filters.
Learn about what red filters can do.
Learn how to use darker filters.
Know how to use green filters.
Learn about blue filters.

title: How to Find the Hercules Constellation
steps: Consult a map or picture of the Hercules constellation for help.
Use a telescope to make spotting the stars easier.
Download a star-finding app to help you locate the constellation.

title: How to Identify Bird Calls
steps: Use a field guide for the area to determine what bird is making a call.
Record a bird call that you hear and match it to another recording.
Download a bird song recognition app to help you identify bird calls.
Listen to recordings of birds you see often so you can identify them.
Watch a bird singing to form a mental connection for future reference.
Go birding with an expert to learn bird calls in the wild.
